replies.bodyText:
AFAIK there's no API allowing to mix Supplier and throwable. Regarding the Javadoc Supplier seems to be for parameters only.
Otherwise, the following is correct:
log.info(() -> String.format("Unable to read the entity - %s", e.getMessage()), e);
Don't really know if it's beneficial regarding verbosity and code reading, wdyt?
replies.author: kevinleturc

replies.bodyText: Ah yes I always forget if it's valid or not. No then keep your old code, it doesn't matter for an INFO message that will have to be generated to go to Datadog anyway.
replies.author: efge

replies.bodyText:
We could also do the following, we have some occurrences in the code:
log.info("Unable to read the entity - {}", e::getMessage, () -> e);
